text.strong: ‌Does your school offer any of the following options to students in <national modal grade for 15-year-olds> whose <heritage language> is not the <test language>?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: These students attend regular classes and receive additional periods of instruction aimed at developing <test language> skills (e.g. reading literacy, grammar, vocabulary, communication).
Before transferring to regular classes, these students attend a preparatory programme aimed at developing <test language> skills (e.g. reading literacy, grammar, vocabulary, communication).
Before transferring to regular classes, these students receive some instruction in school subjects through their <heritage language>.
These students receive significant amounts of instruction in their <heritage language> aimed at developing proficiency in both languages.
Class size is reduced to cater to the special needs of these students.

text.strong: ‌Which of the following <foreign languages²> can students in <national modal grade for 15-year-olds> take at your school this school year?‌

text.em: ‌(Please consider regular lessons as well as other learning activities offered by the school.) ‌

label.text: No <foreign languages²> are offered in my school

text.strong: ‌Are the following subjects required or optional for students in <national modal grade for 15-year-olds>?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌
‌Courses in this subject are not available‌
‌It depends on the programme offered by the school‌

text.strong: ‌What types of additional <English¹> activities does your school offer?‌

text.em: ‌(<Remedial lessons> refer to any lessons offered in addition to regular lessons to meet the school’s <English¹> learning goals. <Enrichment activities> refer to any activities offered in addition to regular lessons for students who are interested in further learning, for example conversation clubs, trips abroad, and language competition.)‌

text.strong: ‌Are the following practices for multicultural and multilingual learning implemented in your school?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Our school offers an exchange programme with one or more schools in other countries.
Our school organises multicultural events (e.g. cultural diversity day).
In our school, we celebrate festivities from other cultures.
In our school, students are encouraged to communicate remotely (e.g. via <Skype ®> or mail) with people speaking other languages.
Our school organises multilingual events (e.g. language weeks).
Our school invites visitors to speak in <foreign languages²> to students.
Our school supports activities that encourage students’ expression of diverse identities (e.g. national, religious, ethnic or social identities).
Our school adopts different approaches to educate students about cultural differences (e.g. teamwork, peer to peer learning, simulations, art, etc.).

text.strong: ‌What is the average size of <English¹> classes in <national modal grade for 15-year-olds> in your school?‌
‌Is your school’s capacity to provide <English²> learning opportunities hindered by any of the following issues?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: <English¹> teaching staff with inadequate teacher training
<English¹> teaching staff with inadequate <English²> language proficiency
A lack of teaching materials and pedagogical resources
Inadequate or poor quality teaching materials and pedagogical resources
A lack of resources for <English¹> <enrichment> language activities
A lack of resources for <remedial English¹ lessons>
A lack of resources for remote <English¹> teaching and learning
A lack of professional development opportunities for <English¹> teaching staff

text.strong: ‌During the last 12 months, have the following staff members below participated in professional development activities to improve their own <English²> proficiency?‌

text.em: ‌(Please consider only development activities that staff undertake as part of their work.)‌
‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌
‌We don’t have this type of staff member‌

text.strong: ‌In your school, are there <English language assistants> involved in teaching activities?‌

text.em: ‌(<English language assistants> are school staff members, but not regular teachers, who have a very good command of the <English²> language and use it in the classroom with the presence of a teacher.)‌

text.strong: ‌To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements about <English¹> teachers in your school?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: <English¹> teachers hold high expectations for student achievement in <English¹>
<English¹> teachers try to motivate students in learning <English²>
<English¹> teachers are engaged with their job
<English¹> teachers strive to reach the learning goals set by the school or the education authorities
<English¹> teachers are motivated to get the best out of their students
<English¹> teachers succeed in getting students interested in learning <English²>
<English¹> teachers put effort into preparing their lessons
<English¹> teachers are motivated to improve their own teaching practices

text.strong: ‌Which of the following statements best describes the situation for <remedial English¹ lessons> for <national modal grade for 15-year olds> in your school?‌

label.text: <Remedial English¹ lessons > are sought voluntarily by students
<Remedial English¹ lessons > are compulsory for the students taking them

text.strong: ‌In which <foreign languages²> can students learn subjects other than languages (e.g. <history, science>) in your school?‌
‌How many foreign languages are being taught at your school <this academic year>?‌
‌How many of the following types of employees are on the staff of your school?‌

text.em: ‌(Please enter a number in each space provided. Enter “0” (zero) if there are none.)‌

label.text: <English¹> teachers (teachers teaching <English¹> as well as other <modern foreign languages1> should be counted as <English¹> teachers).

text.strong: During the last 12 months, have the following situations related to international teacher mobility occurred in your school?

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Our school has hosted teachers from schools where <PISA reading test language> is not the main language of instruction
Teachers from our school have visited, for professional purposes, other schools where <PISA reading test language> is not the main language of instruction
Teachers from our school have participated in activities to share their professional experience in schools where <PISA reading test language> is not the main language of instruction
Funding has been available for teachers interested in gaining professional experience in schools where <PISA reading test language> is not the main language of instruction
Our school has funded some teachers to visit schools where <PISA reading test language> is not the main language of instruction

text.strong: ‌Do the following statements on student mobility apply to this school?‌

text.em: ‌(Student exchanges are visits of any duration in which students from different countries or regions meet in person and spend time together.) ‌
‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: During the last 12 months, our school hosted exchange students from non-<PISA reading test language> speaking schools.
During the last 12 months, some of my school’s students have been on exchange visits to non-<PISA reading test language> schools.
Funding is available for teachers organising student exchanges to non-<PISA reading test language> schools.

text.strong: ‌In your school, what percentage of students in <national modal grade for 15-year-olds> are currently learning the following <foreign languages²>?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Students who are learning <English²> and other <foreign languages²>
Students who are learning <English²> as their only <foreign language²>
Students who are learning other <foreign languages²>, but not <English²>
Students who are learning at least one <foreign language²>

text.strong: ‌In your school, what percentage of <national modal grade for 15-year-olds> students learn subjects other than <modern foreign languages¹> (e.g. <history, science>) in the following <foreign languages²> ?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌
